strategic-cognition-lens.title: Strategic cognition lens
strategic-cognition-lens.summary: A decision lens that separates situational clarity from solution space.
strategic-cognition-lens.intent10: Clarify the situation before choosing tools.
strategic-cognition-lens.intent60: Distinguish what is known from what is assumed. Map constraints and decision rights before proposing options. Reduces premature solution lock-in and improves alignment with stakeholders who hold different mental models.

governance-stack-doctrine.title: Governance stack doctrine
governance-stack-doctrine.summary: Layers of accountability from delivery to board, with clear handoffs.
governance-stack-doctrine.intent10: Define one layer of governance at a time.
governance-stack-doctrine.intent60: Governance works when each layer has a single responsibility and a clear input from the layer below. Stack from delivery (facts and dates) to board (choices and risk). Avoid skipping layers or mixing reporting with decision-making.

operational-transformation-model.title: Operational transformation model
operational-transformation-model.summary: Three phases: stabilize, align, then scale.
operational-transformation-model.intent10: Stabilize before you align; align before you scale.
operational-transformation-model.intent60: Transformation fails when scale is attempted before stability or alignment. Phase one: stop the bleed and establish a baseline. Phase two: align goals, metrics, and incentives. Phase three: scale only what is already working and measured.

section.title: Frameworks and doctrine
section.lede: Original structures used in strategy, governance, and delivery. Proof-forward; not proof-dependent.
